title: Create a GitHub Branch and a Pull Request
description: Create a new branch, update README, and open a pull request on GitHub
example_prompt: Create a new branch called hello-world in my angiejones/goose-demo repository. Update the README.md file to say "this was written by goose" and commit it. Open a pull request with your changes.
example_result:
I've created a new feature branch and pull request:

1. Branch Creation:
```bash
$ git checkout -b feature/user-authentication
$ git add .
$ git commit -m "Add user authentication system

- Implement JWT token handling
- Add password hashing
- Create login/logout endpoints"
$ git push origin feature/user-authentication
```

2. Pull Request Details:
- Title: "Feature: User Authentication System"
- Base: main ‚Üê feature/user-authentication
- Status: Open

Description:
```markdown
## Changes
- Implemented JWT-based authentication
- Added secure password hashing using bcrypt
- Created RESTful login/logout endpoints
- Added user session management

## Testing
- Unit tests added for auth controllers
- Integration tests for login flow
- Security testing completed

## Checklist
- [x] Tests passing
- [x] Security review completed
- [x] Documentation updated
```

Reviewers have been assigned and the CI pipeline is running.
